result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • David J. Santiago was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay fine of $2000 and court costs including all applicable surcharges. Cash bond posted if any shall be applied.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge. 
May not associate with any gangs or disruptive groups.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Shall not associate with any individuals who use or traffic in controlled substances.

timeConds.notes: COMMENCE FORTHWITH  -  Huber & work crew privileges are allowed but not eligible for the Electronic Leg Monitor.  Credit for 60 days served

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Philip Marry.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 1 year in the KCJ forthwith with credit for 60 days.  Huber & Work Crew authorized, but DE is not eligible for the Electronic Leg Monitor.  Court imposes a fine of $2000 plus costs & surcharges to be paid during probation.  See conditions.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 3 years.  AODA Assessment and Ignition Interlock ordered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
from Attny Philip Marry/packet of letters regarding Def

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, David J. Santiago, appeared with Attorney Philip Edward Marry.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered.  DE is ordered to report to the KCJ by 5PM pending Sentencing on 9/2/15 at 1:30 PM.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, David J. Santiago, appeared with Attorney Philip Edward Marry.  Clerk: PT
Atty Marry states case will be resolved and requests another date for a plea at this time; no objection by the State.  Plea Hearing on 7/2/15 at 9:30 AM
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Drees

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Philip Marry.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. has completed an inpatient program and needs to complete WCS requirements.  Status conf. 5/20/15 at 9:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Phil Marry. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 4-9-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.

130pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Phil Marry.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 2/25/15 @ 830am.  State moves to dismiss Ct 2.  court grants motion.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Must be posted by 4:00pm Today.

**MUST BE PAID BY 4:00 PM TODAY**
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License or without ignition interlock device installed
